name: Sheraton Mirage Port Douglas Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION: Good for Port Douglas. In the middle of 4 mile beach. Steps from the Ocean. 15 minute walk to the small town of Port Douglas.
reviews.title: Average Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: Good sized room. Clean. Somewhat outdated furnishings, but good enough.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!
Couldn't get out of here quick enough
reviews.text: HOTEL: Nice layout and very open. Pool layouts were nice, but not kept up very good. Needed some cleaning in the smaller pools.

CITY/BEACH: The town of Port Douglas is small, but interesting. Like a surfer town. The beach is very large with fine sand, but the tides made the beach flat. We were there in November and it was box-jelly-fish season, so we couldn't enjoy the water. Also, there were several little crabs digging in the beach, so we could layout either. Overall, the hotel was good, but I would recommend several other beach locations over Port Douglas.
reviews.title: Excellent spot for a holiday with younger kids who love swimming and sun

reviews.text: FOOD/DINING: Hotel dining is very expensive. Opt for a dinner in the town. There's also a supermarket in the town.
reviews.title: Gets Better with Age
3rd Stay, love it
reviews.text: We have just stayed for our third time at the Sheraton Mirage Port Douglas, and absolutely love it.
Port Douglas is a beautiful part of the world and this Resort made Port Douglas.
reviews.title: Depends on what you are looking for in a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped here on the way back home, SPG member so well looked after, large clean comfy rooms with nice aussie staff who always go out of way to help..our deal had breakfast at poolside restaurant and the best american breakfast have seen in our travels. Resort clean and despite other reviews we read, everyone seemed to be having an awesome time, four mile beach which resort faces onto is just wonderful, can swim in ocean from around May to Sept according to signage, nice stay, we'll return next year and will look at one of the villas which face the ocean, bring sweater as can be cool at night in the Port, Central hotel good for a soda or beer after the Sunday market, about 20 min walk from Sheraton.
reviews.title: Amazing pools, consistent Sheraton, 4 mile beach spot on

reviews.text: We booked a great deal with Qantas including breakfast and other benefits, we found this great value staying there 5 days, one pool was out as they are upgrading the hotel while we were there but there was many other pools (think 6 more lagoons to swim). Rooms are huge and clean, yes very 80s but comfortable and spacious and great size bath, staff are fantastic and always helpful, there is tour desk, Nicole great for orgaisning days trips, the reef trip with kids travelling free is bonus as can be very expensive when all family goes, but trip to reef a must. The Japanese restaurant is very good at Sheraton and breakfast buffet each days is really good, all in all we had a fantastic stay, getting away from chilly Melbourne to Sheraton Port Douglas.
reviews.title: Great Deal, Relaxing Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previous reviewers are correct...the place is old and in desperate need of updating. It is a shame that Starwood does not step in. We found out that it is up for sale, thus no money is being put in to it at all.
reviews.title: The reviews are correct. Stay elsewhere..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our original room was old, mildewed, and the A/C did not work. The staff promptly changed our room the next day as the place was empty. The next room at least had a working A/C.
reviews.title: Faulty A/C, mildewed buildings. This place has seen better days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great. The beach beautiful. And the grounds could be incredible.
reviews.title: Decent place if you want to golf... maybe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in a standard room with starwood points. it was quite spacious with a very large bathroom and bath shower area which must have been quite nice in 1986 but showed its wear in 2006. the resort in general nice enough, covering quite a bit of land, there is a golf club and tennis and such on the grounds, and it fronts the terrific four mile beach although at the time of year there were issues with the jellies. however, it has quite nice saltwater lagoons you can swim in which were quite refreshing. the staff was fairly friendly and professional, no complaints at all. we had a snafu with catching transport to the airport at 5am and the manager came out and personally solved it to our satisfaction, arranging a private taxi to replace the shuttle van that had gotten screwed up. someone here mentioned about limo transport to town, not sure what he/she meant but there is a free shuttle which was fairly convenient. port douglas the down is quite nice, there are many jumping off points to the reef, and there are nice restaurants in a good laid back atmosphere.
reviews.title: A little worn, but some nice features

likes.liked: — Space, proximity to beach, pool areas, staff

reviews.text: My entire family of 22 (10 adult and 12 children) people stayed at the Sheraton Mirage for 2 weeks. We stayed in 3 seperate villas which were on the south side of the resort and were on the beachl. The grounds were so well kept and there were people working on them daily. Housekeeping was efficient and cleaned our villa everyday. The front desk staff were very friendly and accomadating. The tour guides were very patient with helping organize a few of our tours for a mere 22 people. The porters and the transportation team were always fun and friendly and very punctual. The shuttle bus is very handy and takes you right down town. We honestly did not have any complaints. The place is so nice. The breakfast buffet was unbelievable. There was everything imaginable on that buffet. It was included in the rate for the villa's and was perfect with that many people. Everyone could eat whenever they wanted to and it was enough food to hold everyone over until supper. We actually were not that impressed with the seafood buffet at night, don't get me wrong the selection was vast; however, it was quite expensive and did not taste as good as the restaurants downtown. The pools were awesome. I honestly can't say that I have ever seen such spectacular pools. I know some people say they were in need of repairs, however, we did not see this at all. The activities crew were wonderful as well. They were so kind and always assisted us with activities to do ( they taught the kids how to play cricket), provided us with volleyballs, goggles, bikes, etc. We found the entire place to be beautiful and we had a wonderful time and the trip of our lives. The beach was so clean and the water was perfect. A few of the women had massages and said they were very good. Some of the men played golf and said it was a beautiful cours and the staff was very friendly. They even saw croc's both time that they went. In addition, I read every review of this place before we left and was frankly a little nervous about staying there after reading all of the negative reviews. Honestly, I don't get it. The place was gorgous, in our opinion, and fortunately we didn't travel all the way to Australia on Holiday to walk around looking at the so called "outdated" lobby carpet or the "paint chips" in the pool. In fact, we commented while we were there, reflecting back on some of the reviews we had read, and thought thank goodness we don't see the world through the same glasses that some of the other see it through.
reviews.title: We Loved It

reviews.text: I stayed there with my family for a week.
reviews.title: Not worth the 5*

reviews.text: Although I am soooo positive about Australia, the hotel gave me a very bad feeling. I had the feeling that I had to follow so much rules and that I had to participate in a world I do not wanna be in. For example: at night, you have to go to the town in a limo. (you can do a taxi, but then the company that works with the hotel, doesn't look too happy)
reviews.title: Shouldn't be rated a 5 star

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Sheraton Mirage Port Douglas and enjoyed my stay expect for being put out in the boon docks - despite being a SPG Member. The pools are great and the rooms have stood the test of time quite well. Agree with previous comments on this site regarding the kids games room - ghastly. The in-room dining was a bit disappointing, particularly the late night menu that begins at 10.00pm - there are about 6 items on the late night menu and none of them have the basic appeal of a late night snack - I could even get a simple toasted sandwich and some chips! They've created a menu here that suits them and certainly not their guests. Overall though, still a great resort 17 years on - well done.
reviews.title: Stacks Up Well

reviews.text: We were a family of 5 vacationing in Port Douglas and were advised by reservations to stay in the 3 BR units, which turned out to be condos, owned by different people. There is not consistency of quality and we were not happy. I never stay in condos due to individual tastes of decor and cleanliness of furnishings, dishes, etc. Had I been told it was a condo, I would have refused it up front. To the hotels credit, they worked very hard to move as soon as possible (2nights later) into the hotel rooms. We had 2 lovely, renovated rooms. Service was very good both at front desk and concierge. Food was okay. Buffet breakfast good for three teenage boys, included in room rate. Dinner, lunch typical hotel food. Eat in town. Definately stay in hotel, and insist upon renovated rooms! Beautiful setting. Note: we had car and road from Cairns to Port Douglas is treacherous! Be careful!
reviews.title: Picky traveler has mostly positive experience.
Disappointing - urgent work needed
reviews.text: This hotel has a lot going for it - huge gardens and lagoons, plenty of space, right on 4 mile beach, close to the centre of Port Douglas with a free bus into town.

reviews.title: Fantastic Salt Water Lagoons
reviews.text: However the previous reviews about needing refurbishment are certainly correct. Everywhere seems to be painted pink ! Despite the rooms being very generously sized, they manage to feel claustraphobic due to the dated decor and poor lighting.
Given the price of the hotel, there's really no excuse. Money needs spending on this place - there are much nicer places to stay in Port Douglas at 50% of the cost.
reviews.title: A Relaxing Spot

reviews.text: I stayed here 2 nights with family.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings
The perfect place to chill!
reviews.text: Room was I would say OK but the bathroom definately was in need of a refit and quite dull.

reviews.title: Really does need a refurb!
reviews.text: We loved the lagoon pools and spent a lot of our 2 days just chilling at the pool. Good bar/food service around the pool.
Restaurants very pricey. Better to go into Port Douglas but it is too far to walk. You will need to get a taxi there or use the complimantary bus although it stops very early.
reviews.title: Don't let bad reviews put you off.
needs a lot of renovations
reviews.text: We found it fine for a few days to chill but no more if you want the town close by. We moved in the centre of Port Douglas after that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned after a week and I have to say it is not worth the money. The breakfast dining experience was like a zoo, so crowded that you could hardly move or reach food in the buffet. There is also currently no a la carte restaurant, so your only options are a limited room service menu or a $82 pp buffet, which is ridiculous. Otherwise you have to catch a shuttle bus into town. It is old, tired and definately not worth the cost. On the positives, the staff are excellent and it is handy being so close to the beach. If you have cash to splash then it is comfortable enough and the pools are great. Dining is a huge problem
reviews.title: be aware, no a la carte restauran

reviews.text: The Mirage was a nice, clean resort that needs a face lift. Great, quiet location with decent pools and food on a great beach. Service was friendly yet could have been more attentive. The poperty is large and the buildings need to be brought into the 2000's. We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa which was spacious and clean but very dated.
reviews.title: Needs to modernize

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in Villa 440 which was just ok. It was booked independently so was much cheaper than booking through Sheraton. Just as well - I would have been very upset if I had paid $650 per night. The villa had been renovated but the furnishings were dreadful.
reviews.title: Stayed in Villa - Just ok

reviews.text: We had a pool just outside our villa - but it was too cold. My boys love swimming but could only stay in for short bursts.
reviews.title: Definitely not five star

reviews.text: The villa was also a long walk to the hotel - without a clear path (had to cut across the golf course). It was an even longer walk to the pool and beach.
reviews.title: Aged beauty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been to Port Douglas several times in apartment style complexes we deviated and some might say 'stepped back in time' and stayed at the Sheraton. Initial impressions were of an old fashioned boring hotel however staying for 5 nights meant we enjoyed the comfort and amenities of the place.
reviews.title: Its not so bad, its a nice place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best features of the resort are the large rooms and the pool. The room had everything we wanted but lacked that 21st century feel! The bed was comfy, the TV was old, the bathroom wasn't too bad. The pools are vast and fairly well maintained. If you like the big classic US-style hotels with valet parking, big buffets, good housekeeping and large grounds and many staff floating about you will like this. I would have liked to go to the gym but the country club is across the road in another compound and I wasn't sure if hotel guests have access. Oh yeah, food and drinks are expensive but the shuttle to town is frequent and cheap and the town has everything you would need. Check out the sunday morning markets if you are there on the weekend.
reviews.title: Overall a disgusting waste of money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, on the downside there were a lot of families with small kids there, and while its OK for them to be out and about and active and having fun in the pool areas etc, I found it annoying when kids were making lots of noise in the corridor and in the rooms nearby (screeching and crying) - not what you want on holidays so I wish people would take that into consideration. Really its a bit old fashioned at the Sheraton but can be relaxing!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Sheraton Mirage
reviews.text: Rooms shabby, smokers and screaming kids everywhere,internet slowest ever, restaurant very very bad, managment attitude appalling.

reviews.title: great weather for relaxing
reviews.text: Had read the trip advisor reviews on this hotel and decided although some were negative I went ahead and booked a great deal at AUD $245 per night for 2 in a garden king room including full buffet breakfast. I am so pleased I did and the whole experience was faultless from the moment we arrived to when we checked out 8 days later. Gardens immaculate, staff very helpful and friendly, buffet breakfast was fantastic, did not have any other meals in hotel as was fairly dear($82 per head for evening buffet). Valet parking was only $5 per day, bonus. I would go back again for sure!! Lagoon pools were beautiful.

aka: Sheraton Mirage Port Douglas Hotel Port Douglas
description: Beachfront Resort with guest rooms and private Villas on 4 mile beach, convenient to Great Barrier Reef & deep-sea fishing.
